sense.name: deprive someone of ownership
sense.examples: The Depression cheated her out of a happy childhood. The slick insurance salesman is cheating old people out of their savings.

sense.name: practice trickery or deceitful behavior
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent[human]] CHEAT PP{P NP} NP1[agent[human]] CHEAT ON NP2[patient] NOTE: use this sense for any ambiguous examples of cheat where a possession is not overtly expressed. Includes: CHEAT ON
sense.examples: Mary says John cheats at cards. Some of the children cheated on the test. IS Sally cheating on her husband?
